Identification.LongTitle: Regulations Respecting Crossings of International Power Lines or Interprovincial Power Lines Constructed Without Leave of the National Energy Board

Provision.Text: The National Energy Board, pursuant to paragraph 58.33(c)*, subsection 108(5.1)** and paragraph 112(5)(c)*** of the National Energy Board Act, hereby makes the annexed Regulations respecting crossings of international power lines or interprovincial power lines constructed without leave of the National Energy Board.

Section.Text: These Regulations may be cited as the Power Line Crossing Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the National Energy Board Act; (Loi)
CSA means the Canadian Standards Association; (CSA)
holder means the holder of a permit or certificate issued in respect of a power line; (titulaire)

Section.Text: Leave of the Board to construct a facility across, on, along or under a power line or to excavate using power-operated equipment within 30 m of a power line, pursuant to subsection 58.31(1) or subsection 112(1) of the Act, is not necessary where

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: these activities are designed and executed in accordance with CAN/CSA-C22.3 No. 1-M87, Overhead Systems, as amended from time to time, in respect of overhead crossings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: these activities are designed and executed in accordance with CAN3-C22.3 No. 7-M86, Underground Systems, as amended from time to time, in respect of underground crossings;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: written permission has been obtained by the owner of the facility or the owner’s sub-contractor from the holder; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a written procedure and schedule for the work have been agreed to by the holder and the owner of the facility or the owner’s sub-contractor.

Section.Text: For the purposes of paragraph 58.28(1)(c) of the Act, the circumstances in which a person may construct an international or interprovincial power line that passes on, over, along or under a facility are as follows:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the power line is designed and constructed in accordance with CAN/CSA-C22.3 No. 1-M87, Overhead Systems, as amended from time to time, in respect of overhead crossings;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the power line is designed and constructed in accordance with CAN3-C22.3 No. 7-M86, Underground Systems, as amended from time to time, in respect of underground crossings;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: written permission has been obtained by the holder or the holder’s sub-contractor from the owner of the facility;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a written construction procedure and schedule have been agreed to by the holder or the holder’s sub-contractor and the owner of the facility; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the length of the power line will not be extended beyond all termini of that power line.
